meta.name: viewport
meta.title: Mental health resources for COVID-19: It's OK to not be OK

meta.name: Description
meta.content: The coronavirus outbreak may be causing you added stress and anxiety. Here are some tools to help you cope.

ul.style: display: block; display: none; position: fixed; top: 0; right: 0; margin: 0; padding: 4px; list-style: none; font-size: 12px;

a.style: display: block; line-height: 1; padding: .333em .5em; text-decoration: none; background-color: #888; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); border: 1px solid #666; -moz-border-radius: 4px; border-radius: 4px; color: #FFF;

display: block; line-height: 1; padding: .333em .5em; text-decoration: none; background-color: #888; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); border: 1px solid #666; -moz-border-radius: 4px; border-radius: 4px; color: #FFF;

h2.em: It's OK to not be OK.

div.p: COVID-19is the infectious disease caused by the novel coronavirus.Find information, maps, and resources about the coronavirus response throughout Iowa.
The coronavirus outbreak may be causing you new or additional stress and anxiety.Here are some tools from us and our trusted partners to help you cope:
If you need someone to talk or if you need help accessing mental health resources, Your Life Iowa is available 24/7 to talk over phone, text or live chat.

h3.span: Healthiest State Initiative & Make It OK

ul.li: Here are 5 tools you can use to help support your child's mental health during the coronavirus outbreak and social distancing.
Check out our Work From Home Wellnesspage with tools and resources to help you Eat Well, Move More and Feel Better.
Do you know someone struggling with their mental health? Try these tips to talk about mental illness or learn how to help someone in crisis.

div.p: The National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) has released aCOVID-19 Resource and Information Guide.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has a webpagewith information on coping with fear, anxiety, and stress brought on by the coronavirus pandemic.

211 is a resource you can use to find essential services during this time, including food or housing assistance. Dial 211 to speak to someone or visit 211.org. 211 is also answering all of the COVID-19 FAQs here.

Please Pass The Love, a school-based mental health promotion organization, is hosting virtual meet-ups multiple times per week for elementary, middle school and high school students. They've also organized adult programs and have collected useful resources. Find it all here.
To aid individuals and communities during this time, Mental Health America (MHA) has compiled a range of resources and information,including connection tools, financial assistance, webinars and more.
Iowa Department of Human Services (DHS) has put together a fact sheet on "What You Need to Know About Coronavirus & Your Mental Health."

If your organization is looking for communication tools, Polk County Health Services has created social media graphics for a variety of age groups including self-care tips and crisis line information. Find them all here.

div.h5: Help Iowa become the Healthiest State
